intro: Styphelia variifolia, commonly known as the variable heath, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of southern Australia. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes many shrubs and small trees adapted to acidic soils. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white, blooming in spring. Its foliage consists of narrow, leathery leaves that are arranged in a compact, low-growing form. Styphelia variifolia is well adapted to harsh coastal conditions, including salt spray and strong winds.
